body.name: Makeup: The Ultimate Guide
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author Rae Morris is Australia's top makeup artist, having won the prestigious Australian Makeup Artist of the Year award four times over. She is the makeup director for Australian Fashion Week, a twice yearly fashion industry event showcasing the latest seasonal collections from Australia and Asia Pacific designers. Stephen Chee is a fashion photographer who specializes in faces and makeup.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 26 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 14 hrs 51 mins
body.description: Simple, step-by-step outlines that emphasize exactly how to apply makeup complement high-fashion images and make this a gorgeous, glamorous guide that will inspire creative, festive faces. Even the most sophisticated and artistic makeup is easy to achieve with these tricks, techniques, and trade secrets. This reference explores all the essential tools needed, how to find the right products—and at the right price—which eye-shadow colors work best for individual eyes, and how to achieve perfect eyebrows and use fake eyelashes. The 10-minute makeovers for both daytime and evening looks help contour and highlight the face, making each one a walking, living piece of art.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great book that tells you detailed makeup technics...
reviews.reviewText: If you're like me, you will read negative reviews so I'd like to address a few that I read (because I honestly didnt expect to see any for this book). 1) this book, if a "Pro" purchased it, is NOT a pro book. It's covering extreme basics and as a "PRO" you should know those before calling yourself one. So rating a book on your inability to distinguish what the book is, that's on you.2) "heavy application" yeah, a makeup book that shows you how to apply makeup is going to be a bit more detailed than the "natural look" which IS covered in here. I personally use the "bronzed look" every day nearly. I like a more natural look for day.3) the book covers not just technique but gets into detail about what brush to use where which is key to achieving looks.4) most of the looks are for evening wear. They're dark and playful BUT if you have an kind of creativity, you can create lighter versions of the looks. It's not a Holy Bible, it's suggestions. PLAY!5) the "pro" who wouldn't put tape on to create an edge or wouldn't allow her clients to sleep in makeup to make a smudged look... Ummmmm really? I want your name so I can avoid you at all costs since you're clearly more opinionated than sensible. The book NEVER said to have a client sleep in makeup. It was addressing the "day after" a night out and how to make yourself presentable. If you were very smart, you'd have realized this book is for me, the average woman. Not a "pro" who really isn't a pro. And tape isn't unsanitary. It's tape. Your makeup brushes are far more unsanitary than tape no matter how much you clean them. But you're right, you're the "pro" and you know way more than Rae Morris who gets paid top dollar to do makeup rather than read about it.So, if you're looking for a great book that tells you about makeup technics in detail and want some easy to follow options for looks and how to achieve them, this is it. I gave the "eyes" version to my daughter. She loves it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2013
reviews.reviewText: If you buy this book be prepared to possibly discover how little you knew about makeup application and that you have been doing everything wrong for decades like I did. I read this book from cover to cover and it is an awesome book. The author somehow manages to pack extremely valuable information in relatively short passages. The written material is succinctly written and I found very little if any extraneous information. I wouldn't say it's something similar to "Make-up for Dummies" if it exists but the instructions are very easy to follow. The book is separated into chapters by the order of make-up application such as "Skin Prepping", "Eyes", "Foundation", etc. The "Eyes" chapter is amazing with so many different make-up looks and as I said, the instructions are relatively easy to follow. If you're concerned about time constraints, don't be. I'm a fairly low-maintenance woman and I spent very little time applying makeup when I did apply it. I count on spending anywhere from an extra 5-10 minutes a day depending on the look I'm choosing which isn't very significant when I consider the vast improvement in my look. The author does make frequent suggestions on how to avoid spending an exorbitant amount of money on make-up and/or supplies which is very useful particularly for budget-minded individuals such as myself. I could really go on and on about how great this book is. I actually feel more confident going out now (yes, pathetic but true). It was money very well spent and I can't recommend it enough!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2010
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fashion Forward Fun
reviews.reviewText: This book is more inspiration than instruction. Yes, there are step by step instructions and sections on specialty issues, ie, oriental eyes, some makeovers of older women, but essentially the book assumes a certain level of proficiency. That being said, her contouring and highlighting photographs are well worth the price of the book. (Remember to blend.) There are some color charts and tips and at least this author isn't afraid to recommend false eyelashes.The photographs are largely editorial with an emphasis on eyes. Again like couture, it is not for everyday wear but provides a creative impulse to integrate. I liked that she included the older ladies (also lovely model specimens) with assist to their issues. (I also thought it was a major cautionary tale about sun damage.) I would have like to see greater diversity especially regarding age and profession (non-models please). Yes, those fifteen year olds have pefect skin and are totally unblemished by either time or experience. No challenge there. But find the beauty in the imperfection and make it work.Again a fun book to look at with some valuable tips and charts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Possiblity The Last Make Up You Will Ever Buy.
reviews.reviewText: I have been reading/buying beauty books by various make up artists for the past 25 years, and this is one that stands apart from the rest. What impressed me a lot was Rae's knowledge on brushes, makeup-up products, and techniques, information that I never found in the other makeup books. In fact, in reading the other makeup books, I got the impression that makeup artists only give you the obvious, basic techniques because they dont want to spill their secrets, but rest assured that with Rae, that doesn't happen! She freely shares her knowledge in this book, and demonstrates it, which is something that I, who can't afford a world renown artist to work on my face, really appreciates!

reviews.reviewTitle: Libro con splendide fotografie a piena pagina

reviews.reviewText: Excelente livro: extremamente didático e com dicas valiosas que vão desde a preparação da pele, passando pela indicação do tipo de produto (base oleosa, aquosa, cera) para cada tipo de pele/ idade/ ambiente até a técnica correta de aplicação de cada produto. Um livro essencial para quem quer aprender mais sobre maquiagem!

Avant toute chose, c'est un livre en anglais, comme beaucoup dans le makeup. C'est un livre complet mais qui je pense n'est pas destiné à des personnes totalement débutantes dans ce domaine là.Il vous apprendra certaines base, comme les différents types de pinceaux, les différents types de produits, comment préparer une peau avant de la maquiller etc.... Il propose un bon nombre de maquillages à réaliser (en 10 mins, pour les peaux matures, pour les yeux asiatiques etc) avec des étapes plus ou moins détaillées en image, mais qui a mon sens suffises.Par ailleurs, pour contraster avec certains commentaires, les maquillages présents dans ce livre ont majoritairement pour but d'être artistiques. L'auteur est reconnue d'ailleurs pour cela.Pour les commentaires qui parlent de "photos qui ne correspondent pas au tuto présentés", il faut savoir que il n'y a pas seulement un travail de maquillage dans ce livre mais également un travail de photographie y est mis en avant. L'angle de la photographie, la lumière utilisée, la pose du mannequin sont primordiales et parfois oublié par certains.On est clairement sur un livre qui tend à développer le côté artistique du maquillage et non un livre qui va vous apprendre à faire un trait de liner adapter à votre type d'oeil, bien qu'il y ait beaucoup de conseils à l'intérieur.Je le conseille vraiment pour toutes celles et ceux qui souhaitent développer ce côté là !NB: remettons dans le contexte que ce livre a été publié en 2008, les conseils sont toujours valables aujourd'hui, les styles utilisés peut-être moins, mais les techniques employés, les couleurs mises en avant sont elles, indémodables!
This an amazing book. So many usefull tips.Love it.

Zunächst bekam ich ein Exemplar zugeschickt, bei welchem die goldene "MakeUp"-Schrift zerkratzt war. Somit als Geschenk ungeeignet. Nach dem Umtausch erhielt ich ein einwandfreies Exemplar, das sehr gut ankam (meine Schwester lernt Kosmetikerin). Es gibt hilfreiche Tips und sieht zudem gut aus im Regal. Für jemanden der sich seit Jahren selbst schminkt und schon viel probiert steht natürlich nicht allzuviel neues in dem Buch. Vor allem da man mittlerweile alles auf Youtube mittels Video vermittelt bekommen kann. Aber ein Youtube-Video kann man eben schlecht verschenken oder sich ins Regal stellen.Als Geschenk für junge Mädchen, welche gerade anfangen sich zu schminken, empfehle ich aber das Buch Bobbi Brown - Makeup Manual.
